results.authors: By Matthew Burgess and Ronojoy Mazumdar
results.headline: Emerging-Market Bond Rally Threatened as Hawkish Flags Multiply
results.summary: The balmy days of dovish monetary policy that fueled a rally in emerging-market bonds looks to be over as central banks across the developing world turn more hawkish.

results.authors: By Bastian Benrath and Andrea Palasciano
results.headline: Ukraine Bid for Global South Support Falters at Swiss Summit
results.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy failed to win over a number of key nations from the Global South at a two-day summit in Switzerland, casting a shadow over his bid to broaden support in the war against Russia’s invasion.

results.headline: World Economy Latest: Global Rate-Cut Juggernaut Is Struggling to Start
results.summary: Central banks cagey about joining the global interest-rate cutting cycle may reveal themselves this week with a quartet of decisions in advanced economies.

results.headline: Lula Says Tax Fight Hasn’t Weakened Brazil Finance Minister
results.summary: Brazil’s President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva denied that Finance Minister Fernando Haddad was weakened after Congress refused to act on a provisional measure considered crucial for the country’s fiscal balance.

results.authors: By Andrea Palasciano, Bastian Benrath, and Akayla Gardner
results.headline: Zelenskiy Vows to Forge Ahead as Summit Risks Falling Short
results.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy vowed to press ahead in broadening international support for his war-battered nation as a leaders meeting in Switzerland risked falling short in finding a path for a “just peace.”

results.authors: By Arne Delfs and Michael Nienaber
results.headline: Scholz Dismisses Putin’s Conditions for Ukraine Peace Talks
results.summary: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz dismissed demands by Russia’s President Vladimir Putin for Ukraine to withdraw from four eastern regions partially occupied by Russian forces as a condition for any peace talks.

results.authors: By Travis Waldron and Simone Iglesias
results.headline: Milei and Lula’s Frosty Relationship Was on Full Display at G-7
results.summary: They couldn’t be farther apart in the family photo of Group of Seven leaders, nor in real life.

results.headline: Petrobras’s Boss Taps Fernando Melgarejo as New CFO
results.summary: The new leader of Brazil’s state-controlled oil company has tapped Fernando Melgarejo to become its chief financial officer, marking her first key appointment since taking the reins at Petrobras last month.

results.headline: Brazil Funds Boost Inflation Breakeven Bets on Policy Concerns
results.summary: Brazilian hedge funds are betting on a inflation rebound as the central bank’s commitment to keeping a lid on consumer prices came into question after a divided interest rate decision last month.

results.authors: By Daniel Cancel and Andrew Rosati
results.headline: Saudis Woo Billionaires in Rio as Wealth Fund Taps Latin America
results.summary: Under the banner “Invest in Dignity,” the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia let the world know it’s ready to do business in Latin America, hosting a three-day summit on Brazil’s most famous beach.
